note: Combination of early Naskh and Maghribi scripts | Same script as UTO Homily on the Rich and the Poor. Large bowls with sweeping curves for a number of descending strokes. Occasionally the stems of letter alif have a club-like extension to the left of their top point, and the loop of letter Ḍād and letter ṣād has no “tooth”. The base stroke of the initial letter ‘ayn is elongated backward to the right. Sporadic diacritical marks

note.value: Impossible to establish. The following list is based on codicological examination
Description of undertext by Hikmat Kashouh

Bibliography: Stephen J. Shoemaker, Ancient Traditions of the Virgin Mary’s Dormition and Assumption. L. Friderichs, 1854)
